subject: Re: [junit] How Junit will test all assert methods, even if one or more assert methods fails in a TestCase?
msgSnippet: ... Which is exactly why I didn t attempt to write an entry in the FAQ for this, beyond recommending testing everything that could *reasonably* break. Maybe
messageBody:
J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

>>But seriously ... while the FAQ is being updated, can we get the
>>accessor method issue addressed the same way in the FAQ? Something
>>along the lines of "test or don't test the accessor methods, it's
>>your choice!" :-)
>>
>
>As long as I get a hand in arguing the "don't" case. Perhaps for the last
>time! Wouldn't that be great?
>

Which is exactly why I didn't attempt to write an entry in the FAQ for
this, beyond recommending testing everything that could *reasonably* break.

Maybe there should be two opposing FAQ entries:

Why should I test get() and set() methods?
Why should I NOT test get() and set() methods?

Or perhaps just:

Under what conditions should I test get() and set() methods?

Mike


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
